The West Virginia rifle team will start its quest for its record fifteenth national title this weekend when it opens the season against Ohio State Saturday PERIOD

WVU coach Jon Hammond has hopes his team will show the rest of the country the Mountaineers are the team to beat this season PERIOD

 Hammond said PERIOD 

Led by eight returning shooters from last years team including six National Rifle Association NRA allAmericans the team is fit for success PERIOD

Leading the core is senior transfer Nicco Campriani PERIOD

Campriani competed in only six matches for the Mountaineers last season but this summer he separated himself as one of the best shooters in the world PERIOD The Florence Italy native won the gold medal at the fiftieth International Shooting Sport Federation ISSF World Cup in Munich Germany PERIOD

Junior Michael Kulbacki also competed in the World Championships this summer giving him an opportunity to continue to improve over the summer PERIOD

 Hammond said PERIOD 

The Mountaineers topped Ohio State last season  and were led by senior Andy Lamson PERIOD The Colchester Vt. native set the thenschool record score of  with air rifle and smallbore scores of  and  respectively PERIOD

Although the team is in position for a successful season once again Hammond said after a long offseason there is a possibility of some rust from his team PERIOD He doesnt see it as a bad thing and will give his team areas of improvement PERIOD

 Hammond said PERIOD 

Hammond said it is important for his team to focus on getting the win rather than setting records in its first match PERIOD He is excited to finally get the season underway as the team goes for its fifteenth national title PERIOD

 Hammond said PERIOD
